de.dhbwka.swe.utils.util

Interface IPropertyManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PropertyManager

    public interface IPropertyManager
    The Interface IPropertyManager declares the methods to access a basic property manager that provides the application with configuration values that can be stored.

    • Method Detail

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(String propertyName,
                 String value)
        Set properties to be written to the properties file identified by a common property name and a consecutive number
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue

        Example:
        ExampleProperty="something", where the property name is "ExampleProperty".

        Note: apostrophes will be set, too, if they are escaped with e.g. '\':

        ... propManager.setProperty( "sentence", "\"nice weather, isn't it?\"");
        otherwise only the characters enclosed by the apostrophes are stored.
        value - The (new) value of the property.

      • setProperties

        <T> void setProperties(String propertyName,
                       T[] values)
        Set properties to be written to the properties file identified by a common property name and a consecutive number representing the given values.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the resulting properties file in the form:
        propertyName* + "=" + propertyValue

        Example:
        ExampleProperty1="something"
        ExampleProperty2="something else"
        ExampleProperty3="something else, too"

        where the property name is "ExampleProperty".

        values - An array of classes (Integer, Float, Double, ... ) containing all (new) values of the property.

      • setProperties

        <T> void setProperties(String propertyName,
                       List<T> values)
        Set properties to be written to the properties file identified by a common property name and a consecutive number representing the given values.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the resulting properties file in the form:
        propertyName* + "=" + propertyValue

        Example:
        ExampleProperty1="something"
        ExampleProperty2="something else"
        ExampleProperty3="something else, too"

        where the property name is "ExampleProperty".

        values - A list of classes (Integer, Float, Double, ... ) containing all (new) values of the property.

      • setListProperty

        <T> void setListProperty(String propertyName,
                         T[] values)
        Set a group of values as a single property.
        the values are grouped in one line separated by commas:
        Example:
        myPropertyGroup=a,b,c,d,e (where the property name is "myPropertyGroup".)
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property
        values - the array of Strings that will be assigned to the property name. They will be separated by commas.

      • getProperties

        String[] getProperties(String propertyName)
        Get properties of the properties file identified by a common property name and a consecutive number
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyNameX + "=" + propertyValue (where X is a number starting with 1...)
        Example:
        myProperty1="something"
        myProperty2="something else", where in both cases the property name is "myProperty".
        Returns:
        all values of the properties that start with the name given by propertyName.

      • getProperties

        String[] getProperties(String propertyName,
                       Optional<String[]> defaultValues)
        Get properties of the properties file identified by a common property name and a consecutive number
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyNameX + "=" + propertyValue (where X is a number starting with 1...)
        Example:
        myProperty1="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        defaultValues - default values that will be returned, if no Property with the given name exists.
        Returns:
        all values of the properties that start with the name given by propertyName.

      • getProperty

        String getProperty(String propertyName)
        Get a property of the properties file for a given name.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue
        Example:
        myProperty="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        Returns:
        the value of the property with the name propertyName or null, if the property does not exist. Looking at the example above, the value returned is "something" (WITH the embracing apostrophes, if given!).

      • getTypedProperty

        <T> T getTypedProperty(String propertyName,
                       Class<T> type)
        Get a typed property of the properties file for a given name and type. The type is a common class like Double, Integer, String, Float, etc.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue
        Example:
        myProperty="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        Returns:
        the value of the property with the name propertyName for the given type (class) or null, if the property does not exist

      • getProperty

        String getProperty(IConfigurableProperties<? extends String> configurableProperty)
        Get a typed property of the properties file for a given ConfigurableProperty. If there is no entry found, the default value of the ConfigurableProperty is returned
        Parameters:
        configurableProperty - the configurable property whose name is contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue
        Example:
        myProperty="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        Returns:
        the value of the configurable property or its default value, if the property does not exist

      • getTypedProperty

        <T> T getTypedProperty(String propertyName,
                       Class<T> type,
                       Optional<T> defaultValue)
        Get a typed property of the properties file for a given name and type. The type is a common class like Double, Integer, String, Float, etc.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue
        Example:
        myProperty="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        defaultValue - a default value that will be returned, if no Property with the given name exists or if there is no value for it.
        Returns:
        the value of the property with the name propertyName for the given type (class) or null, if the property does not exist

      • getProperty

        String getProperty(String propertyName,
                   Optional<String> defaultValue)
        Get a property of the properties file for a given name.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property contained in the properties file in the form:
        propertyName + "=" + propertyValue
        Example:
        myProperty="something", where the property name is "myProperty".
        defaultValue - This value that will be returned as default, when no property was found for the propertyName.
        Returns:
        the value of the property with the name propertyName or null, if the property does not exist. Looking at the example above, the value returned is "something" (WITH the embracing apostrophes, if given!).

      • printout

        void printout()
        print the main attributes of the PropertyManager Instance

      • printout

        void printout(boolean allData)
        print the main attributes of the PropertyManager Instance
        Parameters:
        allData - if true, all properties are printed too.

      • getPropertiesFileName

        String getPropertiesFileName()
        get the name of the properties file
        Returns:
        the name of the properties file

      • saveConfiguration

        void saveConfiguration()
                throws IOException
        Save the whole configuration contained in the PropertyManager Instance to the properties file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • saveConfiguration

        void saveConfiguration(String fileName,
                       Optional<String> toolName)
                throws IOException
        Save the whole configuration contained in the PropertyManager Instance to the given properties file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the (properties) file to which the configuration should be saved (it can be an other file name that has been set before with the constructor or by the relevant set method (e.g. setOutputFileName(String))
        toolName - the optional name of the tool that manages this properties file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • saveConfiguration

        void saveConfiguration(OutputStream oStream,
                       Optional<String> toolName)
                throws IOException
        Save the whole configuration contained in the PropertyManager Instance to the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        oStream - the output stream to which the configuration should be saved.
        toolName - the optional name of the tool that manages this properties file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • removeProperty

        String removeProperty(String propertyName)
        remove a property from the configuration
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name
        Returns:
        the value of the deleted property

      • removeProperties

        void removeProperties(String propertyName)
        remove properties from the configuration that begin with the same name. This method is mostly used to remove properties that are created with setProperties(String, Object[])
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name

      • addProperties

        void addProperties(HashMap<String,String> properties)
        add several properties to the PropertyManager
        Parameters:
        properties - a HashMap containing the properties and their values (key-value-pairs).
        Note: All existing properties with the same key will be overridden!

      • removeProperties

        <K> void removeProperties(Set<K> properties)
        remove several properties from the PropertyManager
        Parameters:
        properties - a set containing the properties to be removed. The argument is compatible with HashMap.keySet().
